text: Amiodarone-induced thyroid dysfunction is a well-recognized complication. In this study, we report three cases of amiodarone-induced thyrotoxicosis requiring thyroidectomy.
Metformin is an effective treatment for type 2 diabetes. Common side effects include gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea and diarrhea.
We present a case of lithium-induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus in a patient with bipolar disorder who had been on lithium therapy for 15 years.
Aspirin is widely used for pain relief and cardiovascular protection. The study examined aspirin use in patients with coronary artery disease.
Long-term use of corticosteroids can lead to osteoporosis, with increased fracture risk observed in patients receiving prednisone for more than three months.
Cisplatin remains a cornerstone of cancer treatment. Nephrotoxicity is a dose-limiting side effect of cisplatin therapy, occurring in up to 30% of patients.
The patient was diagnosed with drug-induced lupus erythematosus secondary to hydralazine use. Symptoms resolved after discontinuation of the medication.
Statins reduce cardiovascular mortality by lowering cholesterol levels. Atorvastatin was prescribed for the patient's hyperlipidemia.
Carbamazepine-induced hyponatremia is a recognized adverse effect, particularly in elderly patients. Serum sodium levels should be monitored during therapy.
The antibiotic vancomycin can cause red man syndrome, characterized by flushing and hypotension, when infused too rapidly.
